Body:
arvix

sacrificial ram

aries

From a Proto-Indo-European root meaning "jump, spring," cognate with Old High German irah (“ram”), Old Irish heirp (“kid”), Ancient Greek ἔριφος, Armienian արոջ (“lamb”), Old Church Slavonic йарици, Lithuanian erytis and Middle High German ireh (“ram”).

I just wondering the simlarities both in meaning and spelling of them, and maybe they are cognates?
Title: Are L. arvix and L. aries cognates?
